```{r setup, include = FALSE}
## Load UNICEF palette
unicef_blue      <- "#1CABE2"
unicef_darkgreen <- "#00833D"
unicef_green     <- "#80BD41"
unicef_yellow    <- "#FFC20E"
unicef_orange    <- "#F26A21"
unicef_red       <- "#E2231A"
unicef_darkred   <- "#961A49" 
unicef_purple    <- "#6A1E74"
unicef_warmgrey  <- "#D8D1C9"
unicef_coolgrey  <- "#777779"
unicef_black     <- "#2D2926"
unicef_darkblue  <- "#374EA2"

## UNICEF ggplot theme settings
unicef_theme <- theme_bw() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 16, colour = unicef_darkblue),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 14, colour = unicef_blue),
        panel.border = element_rect(colour = unicef_darkblue,
                                    size = 0.5),
        panel.grid.major = element_line(linetype = 0),
        panel.grid.minor = element_line(linetype = 0),
        strip.background = element_rect(colour = unicef_darkblue,
                                        fill = unicef_darkblue),
        strip.text = element_text(face = "bold", colour = "white", size = 10, vjust = 1),
        legend.background = element_rect(colour = NA, fill = NA),
        legend.key = element_rect(linetype = 0),
        legend.key.size = unit(x = 8, units = "points"),
        legend.spacing = unit(x = 4, units = "points"),
        legend.text = element_text(size =  8),
        legend.position = "top",
        axis.line.x = element_line(colour = unicef_darkblue, size = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = 10, colour = unicef_darkblue),
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = 12, colour = unicef_blue),
        axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10, colour = unicef_darkblue),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = 12, colour = unicef_blue),
        axis.ticks = element_line(colour = unicef_darkblue, size = 0.25))

## Katilingban theme
katilingban_theme <- theme_bw() +
  theme(panel.border = element_rect(colour = "gray50",
                                    size = 0.5),
        panel.grid.major = element_line(linetype = 1,
                                        size = 0.1,
                                        colour = "gray90"),
        panel.grid.minor = element_line(linetype = 0),
        strip.background = element_rect(colour = "gray50",
                                        fill = "gray70"),
        strip.text = element_text(colour = "white", size = 12),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 12),
        legend.key = element_rect(linetype = 0),
        legend.key.size = unit(0.5, "cm"),
        legend.position = "top",
        axis.title = element_text(size = 12),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = 10),
        axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10),
        axis.ticks = element_line(colour = "gray50", size = 0.5))

legend.format <- function (prefix = "", 
                           suffix = "", 
                           between = " &ndash; ", 
                           digits = 3, 
                           big.mark = ",", 
                           transform = identity) {
  formatNum <- function(x) {
    format(round(transform(x), digits), trim = TRUE, 
           scientific = FALSE, big.mark = big.mark)
  }
    function(type, ...) {
        switch(type, numeric = (function(cuts) {
            paste0(prefix, formatNum(cuts), suffix)
        })(...), bin = (function(cuts) {
            n = length(cuts)
            paste0(prefix, formatNum(cuts[-n]), between, formatNum(cuts[-1]), 
                suffix)
        })(...), quantile = (function(cuts, p) {
            n = length(cuts)
            p = paste0(round(p * 100), "%")
            cuts = paste0(formatNum(cuts[-n]), between, formatNum(cuts[-1]), suffix)
        })(...), factor = (function(cuts) {
            paste0(prefix, as.character(transform(cuts)), suffix)
        })(...))
    }
}
```

### Posts

```{r posts_output}
output$posts <- renderPlotly({
  req(input$themes_options)
  
  ## Get time period
  time_period <- input$year_start:input$year_end
  
  ## Tally dailies and then filter to specified themes and time period
  x <- topics %>%
    filter(Theme %in% input$themes_options,
           lubridate::year(Posted) %in% time_period)
  
  ## Daily
  if (input$frequency_options == "Daily") {
    y <- x %>%
      count_topics_theme_time(by_time = "day") %>%
      ggplot(mapping = aes(x = day, y = n)) +
      geom_col(fill = unicef_blue, colour = unicef_blue, alpha = 0.7) +
      scale_x_date(name = "", 
                   date_breaks = "1 month",
                   date_labels = "%b %Y") %>%
      labs(title = "Number of questions posted per day by theme",
           y = "No. of questions posted") +
      facet_wrap(. ~ Theme, ncol = 1, scales = input$scale_options) +
      unicef_theme
  }
  
  ## Weekly
  if (input$frequency_options == "Weekly") {
    y <- x %>%
      count_topics_theme_time(by_time = "week") %>%
      ggplot(mapping = aes(x = week, y = n)) +
      geom_col(fill = unicef_blue, 
               colour = unicef_blue, 
               alpha = 0.7) +
      scale_x_date(name = "",
                   #date_breaks = "4 weeks", 
                   date_labels = "Week %V-%Y") +
      labs(title = "Number of questions posted per week by theme",
           y = "No. of questions posted") +
      facet_wrap(. ~ Theme, ncol = 1, scales = input$scale_options) +
      unicef_theme #+
      #theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size = 8, angle = 90),
      #      axis.text.y = element_text(size = 8))
  }
  
  if (input$frequency_options == "Monthly") {
    y <- x %>%
      count_topics_theme_time(by_time = "month") %>%
      ggplot(mapping = aes(x = month, y = n)) +
      geom_col(fill = unicef_blue, colour = unicef_blue, alpha = 0.7) +
      scale_x_date(name = "", 
                   #date_breaks = "3 months", 
                   date_labels = "%b %Y") +
      labs(title = "Number of questions posted per month by theme",
           y = "No. of questions posted") +
      facet_wrap(. ~ Theme, ncol = 1, scales = input$scale_options) +
      unicef_theme #+
      #theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size = 8, angle = 90),
      #      axis.text.y = element_text(size = 8))
  }
  
  if (input$frequency_options == "Yearly") {
    y <- x %>%
      count_topics_theme_time(by_time = "year") %>%
      ggplot(mapping = aes(x = year, y = n)) +
      geom_col(fill = unicef_blue, colour = unicef_blue, alpha = 0.7) +
      scale_x_date(name = "", date_labels = "%Y") +
      labs(title = "Number of questions posted per year by theme",
           y = "No. of questions posted") +
      facet_wrap(. ~ Theme, ncol = 1, scales = input$scale_options) +
      unicef_theme
  }
  
  ggplotly(p = y)
})

plotlyOutput(outputId = "posts")
```

### Views

```{r views_outputs}
output$views <- renderPlotly({
  req(input$themes_options)
  
  ## Get time period
  time_period <- input$year_start:input$year_end
  
  ## Tally dailies to get nInteractions and nPosts
  x <- dailies %>%
    group_by(Theme, Interaction, `Extraction Date`) %>%
    count(Posted, name = "nPosts") %>%
    summarise(nPosts = sum(nPosts), .groups = "drop")
  
  y <- dailies %>%
    group_by(Theme, Interaction, `Extraction Date`, .add = TRUE) %>%
    summarise(nInteractions = sum(n), .groups = "drop") %>%
    full_join(x)

  if (input$frequency_options == "Daily") {
    z <- y %>%
      filter(Theme %in% input$themes_options,
             Interaction == "Views",
             lubridate::year(`Extraction Date`) %in% time_period) %>%
      group_by(Theme, Interaction, `Extraction Date`) %>%
      mutate(`Views per post per day` = nInteractions / nPosts) %>%
      ggplot(mapping = aes(x = `Extraction Date`, 
                           y = `Views per post per day`)) +
      #geom_col(fill = unicef_blue, colour = unicef_blue, alpha = 0.7) +
      geom_line(colour = unicef_blue, size = 1, alpha = 0.7) +
      scale_x_date(name = "", 
                   date_breaks = "1 month",
                   date_labels = "%b %Y") %>%
      labs(title = "Number of views per post per day by theme",
           y = "No. of views", x = "") +
      facet_wrap(. ~ Theme, ncol = 1, scales = input$scale_options) +
      unicef_theme
  }
  
  ggplotly(p = z)
})

plotlyOutput(outputId = "views")
```

```{r views_charts}
output$views_charts <- renderPlotly({
  req(input$themes_choices)
  
  x <- topics %>%
    filter(Theme == input$themes_choices)
  
  y <- x %>%
    #group_by(Theme) %>%
    mutate(Topic = lapply(X = Topic, 
                          FUN = function(x) paste(strwrap(x, width = 40), collapse = "\n")) %>%
             unlist()) %>%
    mutate(Topic = reorder_within(Topic, Views, Theme)) %>%
    head(10) %>%
    ggplot(mapping = aes(x = Topic, y = Views, group = Theme)) +
    geom_col(fill = unicef_blue, colour = unicef_blue, alpha = 0.7) +
    coord_flip() +
    scale_x_reordered() +
    unicef_theme
  
  ggplotly(p = y)
})
```
